content:
• Friday, August 2, 2013
  • SSNI

    Silver Spring looks pristine to investors following big Q2 beat

    • Thanks to today's huge gains, Silver Spring (SSNI +16.6%) is up 88% from a March IPO price of $17, and trades at 4x 2013E sales.
    • The smart grid component/networking hardware vendor trounced Q2 estimates thanks to a 7x Y/Y increase in services revenue to $55.5M. Product revenue rose 23% to $48M.
    • On its CC, Silver Spring reaffirmed guidance for 18% 2013 revenue growth, and forecast 2013 EPS of $0.14 (above a $0.10 consensus). Q3 guidance (possibly conservative) is a little soft: 8% revenue growth and EPS of $0.06 (below a $0.09 consensus).
    • Q2 Gross margin was 30.1%, +90 bps Q/Q and -350 bps Y/Y. Full-year GM is expected to amount to 36%, thanks to an expected 2H jump.
    • Opex +32% Y/Y, with sizable increases in sales/marketing, R&D, and G&A spend.
    • Q2 results, PR, CC transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM

  • After-hours top Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: COWN +7%. STXS +6%. BVN +5%. SMI +5%. HCI +4%.
      Top losers: AMBA -6%. CLF -5%. BGCP -4%. CHTR -4%. BIDU -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM | 9 Comments
  • LDK

    EC approves China solar pact that sets minimum price, import limits

    • The agreement, negotiated between EU and Chinese officials, sets a minimum price of €0.56/watt ($0.74/watt) for Chinese solar module imports, and limits imports to 7GW/year. The deal covers 90 Chinese solar module firms possessing a 60% regional share.
    • EU trade commissioner Karel De Gucht observes the minimum price matches the price at which South Korean firms are selling panels without engaging in dumping.
    • The deal prevents the imposition of anti-dumping tariffs of 37.3%-67.9%; the tariffs were set to go into effect on Aug. 6.
    • European solar trade group EU ProSun, which wanted a minimum price of €0.80/watt, considers the deal unacceptable, and has threatened to file suit.
    • Chinese solar stocks, which took off on Monday on initial news of a settlement deal, saw some profit-taking today. LDK -6.1%. SOL -5.5%. JASO -5.4%. JKS -5.2%. YGE -2.3%. CSIQ -1.9%. HSOL -3.7%. DQ -7.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM

  • The week's ETF movers - Gainers/ Losers

    • ETF Gainers: XHB +4.02%. EWJ +2.90%. XLI +2.43%. OIL +2.24%. QQQ +2.12%.
    • ETF Losers: GDXJ -8.82%. VXX -8.12%. GDX -7.47%. UNG -6.44%. URA -6.32%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • BCRX

    BioCryst soars again, closes week with outsized gain

    • BioCryst (NASDAQ:BCRX) posted double-digit gains Friday following Thursday's announcement that the FDA has removed a clinical hold on its HAE treatment BCX-4161.
    • The shares are up more than 46% since Wednesday morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • CPWR

    Reuters: Compuware on the block again, courting P-E firms and CA

    • Compuware (CPWR +2.4%) spiked higher just before the close after Reuters reported sources have told it the software/IT services firm "has renewed efforts to sell itself."
    • Compuware has reportedly courted CA, the P-E consortium acquiring BMC Software, and other P-E firms who might look to make a joint bid with a software vendor. The company is looking for offers to be made this month.
    • There are no details on CA's interest (or lack thereof) in making a bid.
    • Compuware rejected an $11/share offer in January, and has reportedly seen a fair amount of P-E interest in the past. An April board shakeup might make a deal easier to come by.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • ACUR

    Acura Pharmaceuticals falls after Q2 earnings

    • Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR) struggled through a tough session Friday, falling 6.5% after reporting Q2 earnings Thursday evening.
    • Net loss for Q2 was $3.1M. EPS was -$0.07.
    • The company closed the quarter with $18.4M in cash and equivalents. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • VELTF

    Velti plunges to $1, delinquent payments may total $30M

    • VentureBeat has followed up on its Wednesday report about cash-strapped Velti's (VELT -9%) delinquent payments to app developers using its Mobclix mobile ad network with a column that notes a developer in touch with collection agencies thinks Velti owes ~$30M, and that he and his peers might try to collect via a class-action suit.
    • The developer: "Mobclix owes us pay from last October, and their last payment was in April."
    • Velti calls the $30M figure "completely inaccurate," but adds it can't provide more detail because its Q2 report is due later this month.
    • Velti's contracts with developers give it 90 days to make ad revenue-sharing payments. VentureBeat observes a Q1 6-K indicated Velti had accrued 3rd-party costs of $56.5M, much of which involves money owed by Mobclix.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 9 Comments
  • ESC

    Emeritus finishes higher on solid Q2 earnings beat

    • Emeritus (NYSE:ESC) finishes solidly higher today after beating on its top line Q2 number late yesterday.
    • Net earnings rose 12% Y/Y.
    • For fiscal 2013, the company expects adjusted CFFO in the range of $2.10 to $2.20 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • ONVO

    Organovo prices its 9M share public offering at $4.50

    • Organovo (ONVO -13.8%) is set to finish lower today after pricing its previously announced public offering of 9M in new common stock at $4.50, a 15.9% discount from yesterday's close.
    • Total proceeds come to approximately $37.7M, which the company says is going towards R&D and general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • XSPA

    Vringo soars in late-afternoon trading thanks to court filing

    • A court filing indicates Vringo (VRNG +9%) is entitled to supplemental damages in its IP suit.
    • Shares have taken off in the final hour of trading after hovering near breakeven for much of the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 6 Comments
  • PACB

    Pacific Biosciences soars after earnings, Piper upgrade

    • Pacific Biosciences (PACB +7.9%) jumps after reporting Q2 earnings Thursday evening.
    • Piper's William Quirk is impressed with RS placements during the period, saying that a "renewed sense of stability" makes a Neutral rating more appropriate than an Underweight recommendation.
    • Piper Jaffray's price target is hiked to $3.10 from $2.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • SIGA

    Siga Pharma selects a lead candidate compound for its Dengue fever antiviral study

    • Siga Pharmaceutical (SIGA +7.4%) gains today after saying it's selected a lead candidate for it Dengue fever antiviral program.
    • The selected drug compound appears to have a novel mechanism of action against all four serotypes of dengue virus in preclinical mouse trials.
    • The company plans to start scale-up and formulation work as it pursues Investigational New Drug-enabling studies.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • UPI

    Uroplasty earnings miss forecast; announces expanded coverage for its Urgent PC neuromodulation system

    • Uroplasty (UPI +17%) pops today after saying Medicare administrative contractor Novitas Solutions has expanded coverage for posterior tibial nerve stimulation using the company's Urgent PC neuromodulation system to treat overactive bladder and associated symptoms.
    • The increased coverage includes additional diagnostic codes as well as expansion of on-going therapy from 12 months to up to two years.
    • The company also reported FQ1 earnings last night that largely trailed analysts forecasts. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • LPDX

    LipoScience plunges on CEO exit, revenue guidance

    • LipoScience (LPDX -10.7%) plummets as CEO Richard Brajer steps down "to pursue other interests."
    • Robert Greczyn is named interim CEO.
    • The company says Q2 revenues will likely come in at $13.3M, towards the low end of guidance. Consensus is $13.6M
    • For the full year, the company cuts its revenue guidance to $52-54M, down from $54-56M, and below Street estimates of $55.37M. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • GOLD

    Gold shares largely ignore the yellow metal's bounce off weaker-than-forecast jobs data

    Gold shares fade to the weaker side today, despite the yellow metal futures rebounding above $1,300 an ounce after the U.S. added a lower-than-forecast amount of jobs in July, reducing the likelihood that the fed would scale back its ultra loose monetary policy anytime soon: GOLD -2.6%, AUY -0.5%, KGC +0.6%, ABX -0.3%, NEM -1.8%, GG -2.1%, RGLD -2.1%
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • YELP

    Yelp keeps ripping higher following earnings, guidance, upgrades

    • Yelp (YELP +14.3%) is now up 40% since beating Q2 estimates, issuing strong guidance, and catching 3 upgrades. Short-covering is almost certainly a major factor.
    • Jim Cramer, surveying the huge upward moves posted by Yelp, Trulia, Zillow, and LinkedIn over the last 2 days: "If you take away the shorts, all of these stocks will be lower. That said, they have been caught up in the cult of the Web right now, and until more supply is issued, they remain better to the long side."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 3 Comments
  • HPQ

    CNBC refutes latest Icahn/H-P rumors; shares still up strongly

    • H-P (HPQ +3.1%) surged to new 52-week highs on a fresh rumor Carl Icahn has taken a stake in the IT giant. Shares have given back of chunk of their gains after CNBC (citing sources) refuted the rumor, but are still posting big gains.
    • This isn't the first time Icahn-related rumors have given a lift to H-P.
    • H-P's FQ3 results arrive on Aug. 21.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • AVG

    AVG investors take profits following light Q3 revenue guidance

    • Though AVG's (AVG -10.3%) Q2 EPS beat estimates and revenue was roughly in-line, the company is guiding for Q3 revenue of $100M-$104M and EPS of $0.44-$0.49 vs. a consensus of $104.4M and $0.46.
    • 2013 guidance is for revenue of $416M-$427M and EPS of $2-$2.10, largely above a consensus of $418.8M and $1.91.
    • Shares had more than doubled from their Sep./Oct. '12 lows going into the report, leaving little margin for error.
    • Q2 unlevered free cash flow was $41.2M (+39% Y/Y) vs. net income of $29.4M. Deferred revenue totaled $188.2M at quarter's end, up slightly Q/Q.
    • Subscription revenue +29% Y/Y to $61M and now 61% of total revenue. Platform-derived revenue (i.e. toolbar ads) +12% to $39.4M.
    • A big reason for the EPS beat: opex rose only 8% Y/Y, well below rev. growth of 22%.
    • 155M total active users at quarter's end, +3% Q/Q and +21% Y/Y (down from +32% in Q1). Mobile active users +26% Q/Q to 44M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • WLK

    Westlake Chemical comments on Eastman Chemical's complaint

    • Westlake Chemical (WLK -1.3%) comments on a recent complaint filed by Eastman Chemical (EMN -0.7%) with the Texas Railroad Commission regarding its pipeline that transports ethylene between Mont Belvieu and Longview, Texas.
    • Both WLK and EMN have operating facilities in Longview, and Eastman contends that recent changes made by WLK to the pipeline tariff and the terms and conditions of the pipeline usage, cost and service, were made to delay the divesture of some of EMN's ethylene cracking units and would also impact its production capacity in the region.
    • WLK doesn't agree, saying the changes made to the pipeline tariff were made in accordance with standard practices and reflect market conditions and were in no way intended to impact EMN's operation of its facilities in Longview nor, to delay divesture efforts.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • MWW

    Monster dives on jobs report while LinkedIn soars on Q2 beat

    • While LinkedIn makes new highs thanks to a Q2 beat and strong traffic growth, Monster (MWW -8.7%) is slumping on account of a soft July NFP report.
    • The decline comes a day after shares fell 4% in response to Monster's Q2 revenue miss and light Q3 guidance (EPS of $0.06-$0.10 vs. a consensus of $0.10). The company stated macro pressure remains an issue, and that Europe is its weakest region, but is seeing "some stabilizing trends."
    • Monster's Q2 revenue from continuing ops fell 11% Y/Y to $200.1M. LinkedIn's Talent Solutions revenue rose 69% Y/Y to $205.1M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • HALO

    Halozyme cut to EqualWeight at Barclays

    • Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO -3.9%) slips after being downgraded to EqualWeight at Barclays.
    • The firm cites concern over FDA approval for certain product lines, saying it believes that PH20 remains a commercially viable platform, but FDA concerns over antibodies to PH20 put a damper on the approvability of any blood product such as HyQ and Cinryze in combination with PH20.
    • Barclays thinks the overhang will likely limit the stock's upside potential - especially in light of the VPHM announcement.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • IMGN

    Immunogen gives back early gains from an upbeat FQ4 report

    • ImmunoGen (IMGN -1.2%) gives back yesterday's post-session gains and more after its FQ4 beat on a per share basis, reporting a narrower loss than the Street.
    • Kadcyla sales off to a strong start in the U.S. for its first indication, with additional approvals expected.
    • The company boosts guidance going forward, now expecting FY14 revenues of $66M - $70M, above the Street view of $49.9M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • MXWL

    Maxwell soars after making SEC filings, releasing 3 quarters worth of results

    • Maxwell (MXWL +19.9%) says it has finished its accounting restatement. The company has "filed all required and delinquent periodic SEC filings, and expects to regain compliance with NASDAQ listing rules." Among the filings are a 2012 10-K and Q1 and Q2 10-Qs.
    • The restatement has lowered Maxwell's 2011 revenue by $10.1M, and revenue for the first 3 quarters of 2012 by $9.2M.
    • Maxwell says it posted Q4 2012 revenue of $44.5M (+19% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.12, Q1 2013 revenue of $47.7M (+33%) and EPS of $0.02, and Q2 revenue of $55.6M (+53%) and EPS of $0.15. The Q2 numbers, in particular, are likely going over well.
    • Gross margin was 39% in Q4, 38% in Q1, and 39% in Q2. Opex was 31% of revenue in Q4, 37% in Q1, and 31% in Q2.
    • Ultracapacitor sales totaled $29.5M (+40% Y/Y) in Q4, $33.8M (+82%) in Q1, and (most notably) $39.3M (+101%) in Q2.
    • Maxwell says 1H ultracapacitor strength was fueled by "a European automotive program" and Chinese hybrid bus/wind demand. Automotive and wind demand remains strong, but Maxwell cautions bus demand could slump as customers await a new Chinese subsidy program.
    • Shares had plunged thanks to the accounting review, and the bad news that followed (I, II). But they've been gradually rallying over the last 3 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 2 Comments

  • Midday top 10 Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: STXS +42%. SORL +34%. CNR +19%. CHC +26%. ACTV +25%. ALSK +24%. MCOX +22%. MXWL +20%. KONE +20%. ADHD +18%.
    • Losers: OTCQB:BODY -33%. ADNC -22%. BTH -21%. GUID -18%. WTW -18%. EMAN -18%. VCLK -17%. SQI -17%. LPDX -14%. MRC -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • SQI

    SciQuest guides down, shares fall

    • Shares of SciQuest (SQI -16.8%) are under pressure following the company's Q2 results.
    • The likely culprit for the weakness is SQI's revised full year adjusted EPS and revenue outlook which, at $0.33-0.35 and $87.6-88.2M respectively, is below previous guidance of $0.34-0.38/ share on $89-93M in sales. (PR)
    • Consensus is $0.38/ share on revenue of $91.5M.
    • While he realized that "post-whiff downgrades are lame," Canaccord's Richard Davis nonetheless cut the shares to Hold from Buy and lowered his price target to $22 from $27 earlier today, calling a morning dip "likely." Good call.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • ELLI

    Ellie Mae surges on strong Q3 guidance, cloud software growth

    • Ellie Mae (ELLI +12.6%) expects Q3 revenue of $34M-$34.5M and EPS of $0.29-$0.30, above a consensus of $33.8M and $0.28.
    • 2013 guidance is for revenue of $131M-$132.5M and EPS of $1.08-$1.11 vs. a consensus of $131.8M and $1.09.
    • Q2 free cash flow was $9.4M, above net income of $8.2M.
    • Active users for Ellie's Encompass360 mortgage origination software rose 10% Q/Q and 42% Y/Y to 88.7K.
    • Active users for the cloud version of Encompass360 rose 16% Q/Q and 74% Y/Y to 56K. Encompass360 cloud sales rose 13% Q/Q and 74% Y/Y, and now accounts for 54% of Ellie's revenue (53% in Q1 and 45% a year ago).
    • Encompass360 ARPU +1% Q/Q and +4% Y/Y to $398.
    • Opex +51% Y/Y, higher than rev. growth of 45%, thanks to major increases in R&D and G&A spend.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • BTH

    Blyth plummets on guidance cut, weak promoter count

    • For the second quarter in a row, shares of direct marketer Blyth (BTH -20.2%) tumble on the heels of the company's earnings release.
    • Sales in the Health and Wellness segment fall 47% Y/Y.
    • North American promoter count falls by 50%
    • Q2 ViSalus operating profit slides 83%.
    • FY13 EPS outlook is cut to $0.75-0.90 versus previous guidance of $1.30-1.45. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • BDBD

    FDA sets minimum limits for gluten-free product labeling; Boulder Brands jumps on the news

    • The federal government sets a standard for gluten-free claims on food labels, a step that health officials said would help Americans with celiac disease and bring uniformity to the $4B market for gluten-free products.
    • The agency set a minimum gluten limit of 20 parts per million in products labeled gluten free.
    • The limit is similar to the level adopted in recent years by the European Union, and has been discussed for some time so it didn't come as a surprise.
    • Sales of gluten-free products have become explosive, reaching upwards of $4.2B in 2012, nearly triple what they were in 2008.
    • Boulder Brands (BDBD +8%) - a leading gluten free producer - applauds the FDA's decision, saying that it has spent years advocating for the FDA to create this mandate.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • CHD

    Church & Dwight falls on weak guidance

    • Shares of Church & Dwight (CHD -2.8%) slide after the company's Q2 report.
    • Investors are likely concerned with Q3 EPS guidance of $0.73 which is $0.03 shy of consensus.
    • Perhaps also weighing on shares is management's cautious commentary about the business environment, which CEO James Craigie describes as "challenging" and "difficult." (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • CTRL

    Control4 jumps following IPO

    • After pricing its 4M-share IPO at $16, Control4 (NASDAQ:CTRL) opened at $18.89 and is currently at $19.28, up 20.5%.
    • That gives the maker of end-to-end home automation/remote control systems a valuation of $424M, or 3.9x 2012 sales.
    • Control4 posted Q1 revenue of $26.6M (+18% Y/Y), and a net loss of $1.5M.
    • S-1, IPO preview
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • MSFT

    New highs for LinkedIn following Q2 beat; mobile, Talent Solutions in focus

    • Cantor has upgraded LinkedIn (LNKD +10.8%) to Buy, and plenty of other firms have raised their PTs, as a strong Q2 beat and a positive CC overshadow light guidance.
    • Cantor, raising its PT to $250 from $170, now forecasts a 30% intermediate/long-term CAGR, above a prior 25%.
    • Evercore is pleased mobile unique visitors (per LinkedIn's metrics) rose 102% Y/Y, making up 1/3 of total UVs and raising total UV growth to 45% from 29% in Q1 and 38% a year earlier. Total page views +69% Y/Y vs. +63% in Q1. The firm also observes member growth (+37% vs. +36% in Q1) rose for the first time since Q3 '11.
    • Piper declares LinkedIn unchallenged in a $27B recruiting market.
    • Mentioned on LinkedIn's CC: 2,100 corporate Talent Solutions customers added (up from 1,700 in Q1), raising total to 20K+; Talent ARPU growing; LinkedIn's new apps have boosted mobile engagement by 40%; 250K+ job listings now on LinkedIn, listing growth still above 75% Y/Y; sponsored news feed ads still in pilot stage; fewer large one-off ad deals due to transition; company seeing a "broader industry shift towards performance-based advertising."
    • Shares +106% YTD and trading at 17x 2013E sales.
    • Q2 results, details, slides, CC transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 5 Comments
  • CFN

    CareFusion lower after Smiths Group calls off talks over selling its medical unit

    • CareFusion (CFN -9.6%) is taking a hit after Smiths Group issues a statement saying that discussions to sell its medical unit have been terminated.
    • The Financial Times reported back in May that CFN was planning to buy Smiths Group medical unit.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • SAP

    Jive Software rallies on (another) report of SAP's recent interest

    • Sources tell BloombergBusinessweek SAP has considered buying Jive (JIVE +2.6%) in recent months, along with other companies.
    • There doesn't appear to be any new information about SAP/Jive in this column, relative to a May report stating SAP considered acquiring the enterprise social networking software firm, but decided not to due to product overlap concerns.
    • BloombergBusinessweek also observes SAP is rapidly expanding its Silicon Valley presence. The German software giant has spent $7.6B to acquire Valley software firms SuccessFactors and Ariba, and its Palo Alto-based VC arm has invested $700M+ in startups, including enterprise cloud storage high-flyer Box.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • LGND

    Ligand Pharmaceutical cut to Sell at Cantor Fitzgerald

    • Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND -3.4%) slips this morning after Cantor Fitzgerald cuts the shares from Hold to Sell on valuation, citing caution over the company's pipeline.
    • Regarding Merck's BACE inhibitor - from which LGND receives royalty payments - it says management published an update indicating that it won't know if a change in a biologic marker will result in clinical improvements in the disease until 2017 at the earliest. Cantor calls Alzheimer's "a risky space," and therefore won't include estimates for BACE at this stage.
    • The company also noted concerns about Promacta, saying it spoke with physicians who indicated that that the drug isn't necessary for HCV patients with thrombocytopenia to receive interferon treatment, and treatment paradigms are changing.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 2 Comments
  • RSH

    S&P warns of RadioShack default

    • RadioShack (RSH -12.6%) slumps after S&P downgrades the company's senior notes to CCC from CCC+
    • The agency warns the retailer could default in less than a year unless the cash situation improves quite a bit.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 5 Comments

  • Thai, Philippine shares slump

    • Thai stocks (THD) fall nearly 4% for the week (1.15% Friday) as political instability threatens to derail the SET which, even with recent losses, is still up some 18% since August of last year.
    • Philippine equities (EPHE) slide 1.9% in Manila as SM Investment Corp. (the largest company in the country) falls 8.6% after a share offering prices at a discount to Thursday's close (900 pesos/ share versus 961.5 pesos each).
    • Other markets are quiet with Indonesian (EIDO, IDX), Malaysian (EWM), and Vietnamese (VNM) shares rising 0.36%,0.26%, and 0.45% respectively. The Straits Times (EWS, EWSS) adds 0.33%.
    • See: Regional market recaps from earlier in the week.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • SIRO

    Sirona Dental posts in-line FQ3, announces CFO stepping down

    • Sirona Dental Systems (SIRO -3.6%) trades lower despite posting a largely in line FQ3.
    • Total sales rose 17% Y/Y, driven by strong demand for its Imaging and CAD/CAM products, the delivery of Omnicam trade-ups, and its expanded agreement with Patterson.
    • Imaging Systems sales +22.0% Y/Y, CAD/CAM Systems +20.4%, Treatment Centers +10.2%, and Instruments sales increased 4.5%.
    • The company affirms FY13 EPS of $3.36 - $3.43, bracketing the Street view of $3.41.
    • FY13 revenue growth is expected to come in around 10% - 12%.
    • Separately, the company announced that Simone Blank is stepping down as CFO and board member, and names Ulrich Michel as Blank's successor, effective October 14.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • MYL

    Mylan jumps on Morgan Stanley upgrade

    • Morgan Stanley's David Risinger upgrades Mylan (MYL +6.2%) to Overweight.
    • Price target is $41 which represents an 11 multiple on a 2015 EPS estimate of $3.75.
    • Risinger also says the company's analyst meeting "provided visibility on key medium-long term growth drivers."
    • Also: Q2 earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • BODY

    Calamity for Body Central

    • Shares of Body Central (OTCQB:BODY -30.2%) plummet after a Q2 report which showed little promise for the retailer.
    • Fewer customers led to bigger discounts. And bigger discounts led to an earnings dud.
    • A nice YTD run in the stock has been erased and then some in early trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes

    • Groupon (GRPN -0.2%) has been upgraded to Equal Weight by Evercore, a long-time bear.
    • Chipmakers Broadcom (BRCM -1.4%) and Linear (LLTC -1.4%) have been cut to Neutral by UBS. Broadcom received 7 downgrades last week following its Q2 report.
    • Guidance Software (GUID -17.3%) has been cut to Sell by Benchmark following its Q2 report and light 2013 guidance.
    • ValueClick (VCLK -16.4%) has been cut to Underperform by Raymond James, and to Hold by Needham, in response to its Q2 report and light guidance.
    • Citrix (CTXS +0.9%) has been upgraded to Outperform by Credit Suisse.
    • Cbeyond (CBEY -4.3%) has been cut to Market Perform by FBR following its Q2 report.
    • Automatic Data (ADP -1.2%) has been cut to Neutral by Susquehanna following its FQ4 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • TRQ

    Turquoise Hill to get less for mine stake

    • Rio Tinto unit Turquoise Hill Resources (TRQ +11.9%) lowers the price of a 50% stake it is selling in Altynalmas Gold Ltd to $235M from $300M due to lower gold prices.
    • The buyer is Sumeru Gold BV.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell committee backs new offer, abstained votes to be ignored

    • Dell's (DELL-OLD +4.7%) special committee supports Michael Dell and Silver Lake's revised offer, which includes a $0.13/share special dividend to go with a $13.75/share purchase price, and a guarantee Dell's $0.08/share Q3 dividend will be paid.
    • The committee has agreed to change the date of record for the deal to Aug. 13 from June 3, and (more importantly) has changed the voting rules to ignore abstained votes. Only a "majority of disinterested shares actually voting on the matter" is needed.
    • Dell's special meeting has been adjourned until Sep. 12.
    • The deal's breakup fee has been lowered to $180M from $450M.
    • Dell shares have jumped, but are still trading a little below the deal's offer price.
    • Previous
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 9 Comments
  • VIAB

    Viacom soars to all-time high

  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural -4.6% following Q2 report

    • Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) slightly lowers its 2013 coal shipment guidance to 83M-91M tons from a prior 83M-93M.
    • It 2013 price guidance for Western coal has been lowered by $0.10 to $12.64/ton, and guidance for Eastern Metallurgical coal by $1.73 to $102.20/ton. Eastern Steam coal guidance has been raised by $0.70 to $62.66/ton.
    • ANR's 2013 capex guidance has been raised by $25M to $300M-$350M.
    • The company had an adjusted weighted average coal margin/ton of just $3.90 in Q2, down from $6.23 in Q1 and $8.16 a year ago.
    • 5.6M tons of metallurgical coal were shipped in Q2, flat Q/Q and +10% Y/Y.
    • The company says it had $1.9B in liquidity at the end of Q2, inc. $1B in cash/investments. Long-term debt stood at $3.6B.
    • ANR: "The global market for seaborne metallurgical coal remains oversupplied, further pressuring margins.  The market for export steam coal in the Atlantic basin is currently uneconomic for most, if not all, U.S. production."
    • Other coal stocks are off slightly: BTU -0.7%. ACI -0.8%. WLT -2.7%. CLF -0.7%. JRCC -2.1%.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 3 Comments

  • Market Preview

    • Stock futures slip from early gains after the July jobs report showed U.S. payrolls grew by 162K to trail estimates. S&P -0.1% while European stocks also cooled off following the release. Gold and oil both trade lower.
    • Earnings season is winding down, but Viacom and Brinker International  showed some unexpected strength and trade higher after reporting. Chevron is lower after its quarterly profit dropped 26%.
    • On tap: Factory Orders and a speech from St. Louis Fed President James Bullard that will be closely watched.

    More on Chevron's Q2

    • The company struggled to maintain its production levels amid soft demand and says earnings took a hit from repair and maintenance costs during the quarter.
    • By segment, Chevron's (NYSE:CVX) downstream business saw a bigger falloff than the upstream business. (PR)

  • More on Michael Dell's sweetened offer: dividend to be $0.13

    • The dividend that Michael Dell and Silver Lake could add to their $13.75-a-share offer to take Dell private is $0.13 a share, Reuters reports, adding to earlier speculation from the WSJ.
    • The dividend would essentially take the bid to $13.88, still well short of the apparent requirement by Dell's special committee that the buyout group raise their proposal to $14+ in order for the voting rules be changed so that abstained votes are not counted as no votes.
    • Shares +4.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:53 AM

  • U.K. construction activity demolishes forecasts

    • U.K. construction PMI soared to its highest level in three years in June, jumping to 57 from 51 in June and destroying consensus of 51.6.
    • Residential construction grew at the fastest pace since June 2010 and new orders enjoyed the steepest rise since April 2012.
    • Things are so good that suppliers are struggling keep up with demand.
    • "The swing back to output growth broadened to include commercial and civil engineering activity during July, although housing construction remains the one thing crucial to the sector’s strong upturn at present," says Markit's Tim Moore.
    • "Firms are starting to believe this is the real deal for the recovery, demonstrated by the strongest pace of job creation since December 2011," says David Noble of the Chartered Institute of Purchasing & Supply.
    • Sterling (GBB) is +0.2% vs the dollar at $1.515, but the FTSE is -0.2%.
    • Other relevant ETFs include FKU, EWU, EWUS, DXPS, FXB (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:23 AM

  • Global equities flat-to-higher

    • Major equity markets are mostly flat-to-higher higher following another record-setting session on Wall Street yesterday as economic data in China, Europe and the U.S., as well as the prospect of continued stimulus from central banks, buoy sentiment.
    • "Fears eased about the global economy and reassuring comments from central banks confirmed that the money glut will continue," says Perpetual Investments' Matthew Sherwood.
    • Markets are now waiting on U.S. nonfarm payroll data later today.
    • Japan +3.3%, Hong Kong +0.5%, China flat, India -1.1%.
    • EU Stoxx 50 +0.3%, London +0.1%, Paris flat, Frankfurt +0.2%, Madrid flat, Milan -0.4%.
    • U.S. stock futures: Dow +0.1%, S&P +0.1%, Nasdaq +0.1%.
